description: Unique code that categorizes work orders for routing, rules, and reporting.
Human-readable label describing the work order category.
Optional notes or guidance explaining the categoryâ€™s intended use.
Optional reference to a broader category this type rolls up under; supports hierarchy.
Numeric depth of the category within the hierarchy; 0 indicates top level.
Limits which technicians/trades can be assigned to work under this category; likely a lookup filter; confirm with SME.
Restricts which inventory parts can be issued or selected for this category; confirm with SME.
Restricts applicable asset classes for work created under this category; confirm with SME.
Limits selection to specific assets when creating work in this category; confirm with SME.
Restricts allowable responsible organizational/management units for this category; confirm with SME.
Limits activity codes that can be used when coding work in this category; confirm with SME.
Restricts problem or failure codes available for work in this category; confirm with SME.
Limits which external contractors/vendors can be assigned to this category; confirm with SME.
Restricts equipment resources that can be scheduled or charged to this category; confirm with SME.
Restricts selectable locations/sites for work created under this category; confirm with SME.
User ID or process that created the category record.
Timestamp when the category record was created.
User who last modified the category record.
Timestamp of the most recent modification to the category record.
Flag indicating this category is used for TV/CCTV inspection activities; likely utilities-related; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating this category is used for fire hydrant inspection work; confirm with SME.
Flag marking accident/incident-related work, often for vehicle events; confirm with SME.
Flag marking inspection-type work for scheduling, compliance, and reporting.
Identifier linking the record to a specific client configuration or customization version; confirm with SME.
Presentation or UI styling configuration for the category; likely optional system metadata; confirm with SME.
